title: Citizen Kane
movie_plot: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to decipher the meaning of his last word, 'Rosebud'.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: Lawrence of Arabia
movie_plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united diverse, often warring, Arab tribes and led them in a revolt against the Turks during World War I.
awards: Won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
movie_plot: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and, with the help of an advanced computer, embarks on a journey to Jupiter to find its origins.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Visual Effects

title: Apocalypse Now
movie_plot: A U.S. Army captain is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.

title: Taxi Driver
movie_plot: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decay and depravity of the city fuels his desire for violent action.

title: Blade Runner
movie_plot: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.

title: The Big Lebowski
movie_plot: Jeff 'The Dude' Lebowski, a Los Angeles slacker, is mistaken for a millionaire with the same name, and is drawn into a complex kidnapping plot.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
movie_plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Amadeus
movie_plot: The story of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart is told by Antonio Salieri, the jealous composer who believes that Mozart's talent is a gift from God and that he is being used as a divine instrument.
awards: Won 8 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens, Peter Jackson
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
movie_plot: A young Hobbit, Frodo Baggins, inherits a powerful and evil ring and embarks on a perilous quest with a fellowship of companions to destroy it in the fires of Mount Doom.

title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
movie_plot: In 1936, a globe-trotting archaeologist is tasked by the government to find the Ark of the Covenant, a biblical relic of immense power, before the Nazis get to it.

title: Goodfellas
movie_plot: The story of Henry Hill, a mobster who, with his two gangster companions, lives the high life of organized crime until he decides to cooperate with the FBI and enter the witness protection program.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for Joe Pesci

title: Die Hard
writer: Jeb Stuart, Steven E. de Souza
movie_plot: New York City cop John McClane tries to save his wife and several others taken hostage by a group of German terrorists during a Christmas party at a Los Angeles skyscraper.

title: Pulp Fiction
movie_plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: The Usual Suspects
movie_plot: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which are all part of a complex plot run by an enigmatic crime lord.

title: The Green Mile
movie_plot: A death row prison guard discovers a strange gift in one of his new inmates, a black man accused of a heinous crime who has the ability to heal others.

title: Forrest Gump
movie_plot: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal, and other historical events unfold from the perspective of a man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Saving Private Ryan
movie_plot: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers goes behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose three brothers have been killed in action.

title: Gladiator
writer: David Franzoni, John Logan, William Nicholson
movie_plot: A former Roman General sets out to exact revenge on the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Matrix
movie_plot: A computer hacker learns from a mysterious group of rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

title: Fight Club
movie_plot: An insomniac office worker looking for a way to change his life crosses paths with a devil-may-care soap maker and they form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
awards: Nominated for Academy Award for Best Sound Effects Editing

title: Inception
movie_plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.

title: The Departed
movie_plot: An undercover state cop who has infiltrated an Irish gang and a mole in the police force who works for the same mobster struggle to identify each other before they are exposed to the enemy.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
movie_plot: The adventures of Gustave H, a legendary concierge at a famous hotel from the fictional Republic of Zubrowka between the first and second World Wars, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his most trusted friend.

title: A Beautiful Mind
movie_plot: After a brilliant but asocial mathematician accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens, Peter Jackson
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
movie_plot: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.
awards: Won 11 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Schindler's List
movie_plot: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.
awards: Won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Pianist
movie_plot: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive in the Warsaw Ghetto during World War II.

title: American History X
movie_plot: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.
awards: Nominated for Academy Award for Best Actor for Edward Norton

title: Casablanca
writer: Julius J. Epstein, Philip G. Epstein, Howard Koch
movie_plot: A cynical nightclub owner in Casablanca is torn between love and duty when his former lover resurfaces with her husband, a leader of the resistance against the Nazis.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Shining
movie_plot: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
movie_plot: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home planet.

title: Finding Nemo
writer: Andrew Stanton, Bob Peterson, David Reynolds
movie_plot: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Animated Feature Film

title: The Sixth Sense
movie_plot: A boy who can see dead people seeks the help of a child psychologist.

title: Spirited Away
movie_plot: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Animated Feature Film

title: The Truman Show
movie_plot: A kind-hearted man lives his life not knowing that he is the sole subject of a 24-hour reality television show.

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
writer: Charlie Kaufman, Michel Gondry, Pierre Bismuth
movie: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
movie_plot: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a procedure to have each other erased from their memories.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: The Social Network
movie_plot: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea, and by the co-founder with whom he is now in a bitter dispute.

title: No Country for Old Men
movie_plot: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and takes a bag of money that isn't his.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Pan's Labyrinth
movie_plot: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
movie_plot: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stockbroker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption, and the federal government.

title: V for Vendetta
movie_plot: In a future British tyranny, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of 'V', plots to overthrow the government with the help of a young woman.

title: A Clockwork Orange
movie_plot: In future Britain, a gang leader is imprisoned and undergoes a bizarre government program to suppress his violent tendencies.

title: The Godfather: Part II
movie_plot: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens, Stephen Sinclair, Peter Jackson
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
movie_plot: While Frodo and Sam continue their journey to Mordor, the rest of the fellowship battles against the forces of Saruman and Sauron.

title: Interstellar
movie_plot: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Visual Effects

title: Whiplash
movie_plot: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

title: The Godfather: Part III
movie_plot: Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, seeks to legitimize his family's criminal empire and redeem himself with the help of his nephew.

title: Psycho
movie_plot: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

title: City of God
movie_plot: In the slums of Rio, two boys' paths diverge as one becomes a photographer and the other a drug dealer.

title: L.A. Confidential
writer: James Ellroy, Brian Helgeland, Curtis Hanson
movie_plot: Three detectives in 1950s Los Angeles investigate a series of murders and a conspiracy that leads to the highest levels of the city's corrupt police force.

title: Up
movie_plot: A 78-year-old man, a young Wilderness Explorer, and a talking dog embark on a journey to the wilds of South America in a house lifted by balloons.

title: WALL-E
writer: Andrew Stanton, Pete Docter, Jim Reardon
movie_plot: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Animated Feature Film

title: Reservoir Dogs
movie_plot: After a simple jewelry heist goes terribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

title: Oldboy
writer: Garon Tsuchiya, Nobuaki Minegishi, Park Chan-wook
movie_plot: After being held captive for 15 years, Oh Dae-su is released and given a five-day deadline to find his captor.
awards: Won Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
writer: George Miller, Brendan McCarthy, Nico Lathouris
movie_plot: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the help of a group of female prisoners and a drifter named Max.

title: The Dark Knight
movie_plot: When the menace known as the Joker emerges from his mysterious past, he wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, and Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

title: Parasite
movie_plot: The poor Kim family schemes to become employed by the wealthy Park family, and a complex and tangled web of deceit, class struggle, and unexpected events ensues.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Inglourious Basterds
movie_plot: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers known as the 'Basterds' is chosen to spread fear and terror throughout the Third Reich by scalping and killing Nazis.
awards: Won Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for Christoph Waltz

title: Gladiator
writer: David Franzoni, John Logan, William Nicholson
movie_plot: A former Roman General sets out to exact revenge on the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Matrix
movie_plot: A computer hacker learns from a mysterious group of rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

title: Fight Club
movie_plot: An insomniac office worker looking for a way to change his life crosses paths with a devil-may-care soap maker and they form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
awards: Nominated for Academy Award for Best Sound Effects Editing

movie_plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.
